#summary Coding Conventions (Issue 1)

 * Follow the same conventions observed by the YUI team. 
 * The Yazaar extensions should look and feel like YUI components.
 * Conventions observed in code created for later releases are preferred to conventions of earlier releases.

== Coding Style ==
 
 * Observe Crockford's [http://javascript.crockford.com/code.html Code Conventions for the JavaScript Programming Language].
   ** Exception: A leading underscore may be used to indicate methods intended as private.
 * In general, observe Java coding conventions, as described by Sun and Elements of Java Style

=== Notes ===
 
 * Mark any known issues or feature requests with TODO comments
 * File issue tickets for significant TODOs
 * Do not use version designations, since Yazaar does not do releases per se (only distributions)

== Coding Tools ==

 * Validate submissions and revisions with [http://www.javascriptlint.com/ JavaScript Lint].
 * Do not use HTML Tidy to format test pages, since it upsets the script formatting. 
 ** *Do* validate all test pages with HTML Tidy or the !FireFox HTML validator plugin before committing

=== Variable Type Prefix ===

|| {{{aFoo}}}  || array ||
|| {{{dtFoo}}} || date   ||
|| {{{eFoo}}}  || error  || 
|| {{{elFoo}}} || HTML element || 
|| {{{fnFoo}}} || function ||
|| {{{nFoo}}}  || number ||
|| {{{oFoo}}}  || object ||
|| {{{onFoo}}}}|| function to handle foo event ||
|| {{{sFoo}}}  || string ||
||             || regular expression ||

|| {{{isFoo}}} || boolean || also {{{hasFoo}}}, {{{useFoo}}} ||


== File Format ==

!JavaScript files should include a copyright and license header, and JSDoc Comments. Code may also be organized into a common set of regions.

=== Copyright/License Header ===

{{{
/*
Copyright (c) 2007, Husted dot Com Inc. All rights reserved.
Portions Copyright (c) 2007, Yahoo!, Inc. All rights reserved.
Code licensed under the BSD License:
http://developer.yahoo.net/yui/license.txt
*/
}}}

=== JSDoc Comments ===

 * All code submissions must be fully documented, in the YUI style.
 * As suggested by JS Doc, observe the Sun JavaDoc conventions

{{{
/**
 * The module object is ....
 * @module 
 * @requires
 * @optional
 * @title
 * @beta
 */

/****************************************************************************/
/****************************************************************************/
/****************************************************************************/

/**
 * Class is ...
 * @description (deprecated?)
 * @namespace
 * @class
 * @method
 * @property
 * @event
 * @uses
 * @static
 * @type
 * @private
 * @constructor
 * @param {type} name Remark
 * @return
*/
}}}

=== Common Code Regions ===

 * Constructor
 * DOM Events
 * Custom Events
 * Public constants
 * Private member variables
 * Private methods
 * Private DOM Event Handlers
 * Private Custom Event Handlers
 * Public member variables
 * Public methods
 * Public DOM Event Handlers
 * Public Custom Event Handlers

{{{
/////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
//
// $REGION$
//
/////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
}}}
